project.teaser: The European Technology and Innovation Platform Bioenergy - Support of Renewable Fuels and Advanced Bioenergy Stakeholders 2022-2025 (ETIP-B2022-2025) project aims at triggering collaborative efforts of stakeholders from research to innovation to implementation in the field of...
project.objective:
The European Technology and Innovation Platform Bioenergy - Support of Renewable Fuels and Advanced Bioenergy Stakeholders 2022-2025 (ETIP-B2022-2025) project aims at triggering collaborative efforts of stakeholders from research to innovation to implementation in the field of renewable fuels and bioenergy. The project will support and empower stakeholders contributions to the Green Deal and the Strategic Energy Technology (SET)-Plan. The European Technology and Innovation Platfrom Bioenergy (ETIP Bioenergy) aims to actively engage with stakeholders and civil society, link their needs to policy making of the European Union and Member States, and to provide advice to industry. The ETIP-B2022-2025 projects objective is to support ETIP Bioenergy in this task.
To achieve these objectives, the project will facilitate Steering Committee and Working Group meetings for ETIP Bioenergy, provide information on research and innovation activities, related technologies and policies on the ETIP Bioenergy website, engage with stakeholders from all involved sectors for information exchange and to provide a basis for ETIP Bioenergy documents, form citizens panels to develop citizens visions on the role of renewable fuels and bioenergy, and develop policy recommendations. Specific features will include facilitating an update of the Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda (SRIA), a biofuels and bioenergy innovation challenge (BBIC), a policy workshop, two Stakeholder Plenary Meetings (SPM) and the development of a financial independence plan for ETIP Bioenergy. All activities will be widely communicated through newsletters, social media postings and dissemination events.
project.title: EUROPEAN TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION PLATFORM BIOENERGY - SUPPORT OF RENEWABLE FUELS AND ADVANCED BIOENERGY STAKEHOLDERS 2022-2025
project.keywords: multi-stakeholder-support, bioenergy, renewable fuels, biofuels, SET-Plan, stakeholder engagement, outreach to civil society

result.title: 10 citizens´visions on socially inclusive bioenergy actions for the implementation of the SET Plan
result.description: D5.2 will summarize the results of the process on participatory community consultations. It will contain a synthesis final verson of the citizens' visions. D5.2 refers to Task 5.2.

result.title: Two written contributions to reports co-produced with one or more other ETIPs or non-bioenergy associations, proceedings from joint events
result.description: "D2.2 comprises 2 wirtten contributions or events. These are elaborated/held with other ETIPs on specific topics (e.g. ""Skills and jobs in the bioenergy sector"" or ""Strategies for boosting public acceptance""), which will be decided on during the project. D2.2 refers to Task 2.5."

result.title: Online proceedings of 2. Stakeholder Plenary Meeting
result.description: D4.5 will contain key highlights of the SPMs held in the second half of the project. These highlights will be presented in a short and visually attractive report. D.4.5 refers to Task 4.5.

result.title: Interactive map of biofuels and bioenergy projects
result.description: D3.3 is the final version of the already existing interactive map. It is on ongoing and recently finished nationally funded projects in member countries of the Implementation Working Group for SET Plan Action 8 - Renewable Fuels and Bioenergy (IWG8). D3.3 refers to Task 3.2.

result.title: Report providing input to the update of SRIA
result.description: In D4.2 the insights and information from a series of webinars that support the update of the SRIA will be collected. Contents of the webinars could be e.g. biodiversity, renewable fuels in shipping, etc. but also presentations of public consultations or updates of the advanced biofuels production facilities database. D.4.2 refers to Task 4.2.

result.title: Policy needs and gaps for a sustainable bioenergy sector
result.description: D3.1 will contain the results from feedback of relevant stakeholders that was collected at workshops or in interviews. It will also summarize the documents the feedback fed in, like e.g. white papers or public hearings at the European Parliament. D3.1 refers to Task 3.3.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - ETIP-B2022-2025 (EUROPEAN TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION PLATFORM BIOENERGY - SUPPORT OF RENEWABLE FUELS AND ADVANCED BIOENERGY STAKEHOLDERS 2022-2025)

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: BBIC Summary paper, challenge schemes and lessons learned
result.description: D3.2 will contain the results of the Bioenergy and Biofuels Innovation Challenge (BBIC). It will present elaborated innovative concepts, as well as challenges and lessons learned. D3.2 refers to Task 3.4.

result.title: Manual with policy guidelines
result.description: D6.3 is a detailed manual of policy guidelines with concrete steps to increasing inclusiveness and comprehensiveness of the engagement process. It will contain key takeaways from the policy co-creation exercises within Task 5.2. D6.3 refers to Task 6.5.

result.title: Online proceedings of 1. Stakeholder Plenary Meeting
result.description: D4.3 will contain key highlights of the SPMs held in the first half of the project. These highlights will be presented in a short and visually attractive report. D4.3 refers to Task 4.5.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
